Member Function Documentation

Access.Access ( $  login = '',
$  pw = '' 
)

Constructor. If login and password are passed as parameters, the access data are immediately loaded.

For example:

$user = & new Access('Smith','Cocapabana'); if( $user->isKnown() && $user->hasValidPassword && $user->isNotLocked()){ ... }

Parameters:
string Login name
string Password public
Returns:
boolean

Access.roleAccess ( $  id  ) 

Loads the role data

Parameters:
int $id the id of the selected role
Returns:
boolean

Access.loadAccess ( $  login = '',
$  pw = '' 
)

Loads the user data and checks its access status. Use if login and password were not passed during construction OR if a new access data is to be loaded using the same object instance.

For example:

$user = & new Access; .... $user->loadAccess('Smith','Cocapabana'); if( $user->isKnown() && $user->hasValidPassword && $user->isNotLocked()){ ... }

Parameters:
string Login name
string Password public
Returns:
boolean

ADODB-db-link

Access.loadRole ( $  id  ) 

Loads the role Status

Parameters:
int $id Role ID
Returns:
boolean

ADODB-db-link

Access.hasValidPassword (  ) 

Returns the password status of the user public

Returns:
boolean TRUE = password valid, else FALSE = invalid password

Access.isKnown (  ) 

Returns the user status of the user whether he is registered user or not. public

Returns:
boolean TRUE = is registered as user, else FALSE = invalid user

Access.isLocked (  ) 

Returns the user permission "is locked?" status. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
boolean TRUE = User permissionis locked, else FALSE = user unknown or unregisted

Access.isNotLocked (  ) 

Returns the permission "is not locked?" status. A negation of isLocked() method. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
boolean FALSE = User permission is locked, else TRUE = permission is locked

Access.Name (  ) 

Returns the user's registered name. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
string

Access.LoginName (  ) 

Returns the user's login name ( login username ). Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
string

Access.PermissionAreas (  ) 

Returns the permission areas of the user. No interpretation is returned. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
string

Access.PermittedDepartment (  ) 

Returns the permission dept of the user. No interpretation is returned. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Returns:
string

Access.isPermitted ( $  area = ''  ) 

Checks if the user is permitted in a given protected area.

Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Parameters:
string The area to be checked.
Returns:
string

Access.setAllowedAreas ( $  areas = ''  ) 

Sets the allowed hierarchical areas.

Parameters:
array The allowed areas in hierarchy. public
Returns:
string

Access.isPermittedInGroup ( $  user_area = ''  ) 

Checks if the user is permitted in the group of protected areas.

This checks also whether the user is permitted in the area due to its role or position in the privilege hierarchy. The group of areas must be set first with the "setAllowedAreas()" method. Use only after the access data was loaded by the constructor or loadAccess() method. public

Parameters:
string The area to be checked.
Returns:
string

Access.UserExists ( $  login_id  ) 

Checks the data if user exists based on his username (login id)

Parameters:
string Username or login id
Returns:
mixed adodb record or boolean FALSE
